outline.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
outline.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: a broad outline of the committee’s plans
A debt reduction scheme was agreed in outline  (=people agreed on its main points).
outline.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a line around the edge of something which shows its shape
outline.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The outlines of animals were cut into the rock.
outline.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a plan for a piece of writing in which each new idea or fact is separately written down
outline.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Always write an outline for your essays.
outline.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 1: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
outline.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The report gives only a broad outline of the company's performance.
Each chapter begins with a brief outline of the topics covered in the chapter.
I remembered the basic outline of the story, but not how it ended.
Thompson gave me a rough outline of what had happened at the previous meeting.
The paragraph gives readers only the bare outline of Milton's life.
The leaflet gives you an outline of the Party's main policies.
The first chapter provides an outline of the theory of evolution.
outline.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 2: a line around the edge of something which shows its shape
outline.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: I could just make out a vague outline of a barn.
Through the spaces between the bars he saw the blurred outline of the oil derrick high in the sky.
Peeling off the tape after the paint has dried leaves a clear outline to the shapes.
First, I draw out the outline of the leaf onto paper, and start adding areas of colour.
She traced the outline of his lips with her fingers.
an outline map of the island
Once I am happy with the outline sketch, I start painting.
outline.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details
outline.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The new president outlined plans to deal with crime, drugs, and education.
outline.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to show the edge of something, or draw around its edge, so that its shape is clear
outline.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: a map with our property outlined in red
outline.translation[1].definitions[1].no: Outline is usually passive in this meaning
